captions.text:
So we're going to show you in
this series how we develop our

cars, and what kind of
technology goes into them.

It's very important to
understand that, in order to

raise the bar in such a
competitive marketplace, you

It's not possible to just put
run-of-the-mill technology

into a car and think it's
going to be better than

What's even more important is
that these innovations can

trickle down into more normal
cars over time, and for the

So these cars are not only
about fun and driving

It's actually about technology
being able to change

So in this series, we're going
to show you what makes our

cars the best cars
in the world.

comments.text:
milöterrorism? antar att du inte flyger flygplan när du åker på semester? 
Koenigsegg har tillverkat 100 bilar på 10 år, dessutom används de knappt. 
Och för att tillägga, ungefär hälften av dessa 100 bilar är byggda för att 
köra på etanol. Kan garantera dig att Koenigseggs bilar är mer skonsamma 
mot miljön än din sunkiga Volvo 240 du kör.

comments.text: I was supposed to delete this since the Veyron was built before the Audi R8.
comments.author: footiedavanas

comments.text:
Well thats not really true, even if the two share some similar features 
they were designed entirely in different workshops under two very different 
philosophies. While it is true that VWAG owns both Audi and Bugatti the 
VWAG really lets their sub car companies do their own thing when it comes 
to their high end autos. That said, I would take an R8 over a Veyron and I 
would take any Koenigsegg over either one. The Veyron is not a sports car, 
it is an experiment (a quote from the design team).
comments.author: Andres Gonzalez

comments.text:
everyone go buy a koenigsegg so they can have production numbers to compete 
in FIA GT1.
comments.author: Darius Anderson

comments.text:
Not to mention, a set of tires for the Bugatti are $40,000. Why? I have no 
damn clue. There is also only one place in the United States that mounts 
them. On top of that, they REQUIRE that you replace the wheels ever third 
tire change. Which is another 69,000.
comments.author: Th3Ap3x

comments.text: Dont forget the SSC Ultimate Aero
comments.author: Th3Ap3x

comments.text:
The Bugatti Veyron is just a powered up version of a Audi R8; They both 
look extremely similar in so many levels. I would much rather have a 
Koenigsegg CCXR or Agera R than a Bugatti Veyron.
comments.author: footiedavanas

comments.text:
Exactly. The Koenigsegg has half as many cylinders as the Bugatti. And 
their top speeds only differ by ~15 mph. Aside from the Veyron's power 
plant engine, it doesn't have much going for it. And its ugly as hell in my 
opinion.

What American calls the Mustang a super car? Either way your dismissive 
statements about American cars are pretty stupid, a few American supercars 
are the Ford GT, Saleen S7 and S5S Raptor, Vector M12, Mach 7 Falcon, 
Rossion Q1, and not to mention the Chrysler ME-412 which was cancelled 
because good old Mercedes didn't want an American car outperforming their 
cars. Man, some of you people are unnecessarily hateful when it comes to 
American cars.

comments.text:
I'd say it's got super-car performance, but it doesn't have the same 
wow-factor in other ways. Or maybe the word is wrong... the ZR1 IS a 
SUPERCAR, but not a HYPERCAR. Hyper cars are the insane machines more like 
the Zonda and Koenigsegg, not more mundane things like the 458 Italia and 
ZR1. Yes those are fast, and have technology and pantomime in their own 
ways, but they aren't the same sort of off-the-wall insanity.
comments.author: Harvey Duncan
